issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

This issue was noticed while doing an accidental negative test.  The setup is as follows:

# Create an ELB
# Create an Autoscaling group associated with the ELB
# Add an ELB Health Check to your Auto Scaling Group

More specific details about setting up the ELB, Autoscaled application can be found in the [comments below|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-9472?focusedCommentId=73848&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-73848].

This starts a vicious cycle of starting AutoScaling instances, and terminating them.  From the looks of it, the ELB never sees the instances reach 'InService' regarding the health check.  Instances either show up in 'OutofService' or don't show up at all.

Let this occur for about 5 minutes, then configure a health check for the ELB.  This will slow down the cycle of instances terminating/launching. 

{code}
$ eulb-configure-healthcheck NginxLoadBalancer --target "HTTP:80/" --interval 30 --timeout 2 --unhealthy-threshold 2 --healthy-threshold 2 --region account1-user01@VLADR

### waited for another cycle of instance termination

$ eulb-configure-healthcheck NginxLoadBalancer --target "HTTP:80/" --interval 60 --timeout 2 --unhealthy-threshold 2 --healthy-threshold 2 --region account1-user01@VLADR

### waited for another cycle of instance termination

$ eulb-configure-healthcheck NginxLoadBalancer --target "HTTP:80/" --interval 120 --timeout 2 --unhealthy-threshold 2 --healthy-threshold 2 --region account1-user01@VLADR

### waited for another cycle of instance termination

$ eulb-configure-healthcheck NginxLoadBalancer --target "HTTP:80/" --interval 120 --timeout 2 --unhealthy-threshold 4 --healthy-threshold 2 --region account1-user01@VLADR

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# eulb-describe-lbs --show-long --region account1-user01@VLADR
LOAD_BALANCER	NginxLoadBalancer	NginxLoadBalancer-408396244283.elb.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com			{interval=120,target=HTTP:80/,timeout=2,healthy-threshold=2,unhealthy-threshold=4}	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				{protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80}					{owner-alias=944786667073,group-name=euca-internal-408396244283-NginxLoadBalancer}		2014-05-28T11:54:35.266Z
{code}

Instances will reach running state, however they will not get the information from metadata service:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-get-console-output i-F36C1BD6 --region account1-user01@VLADR
i-F36C1BD6

^[[1;256r^[[256;256H^[[6n
Google, Inc.
Serial Graphics Adapter 12/07/11
SGABIOS $Id: sgabios.S 8 2010-04-22 00:03:40Z nlaredo $ (mockbuild@c6b18n1.dev.centos.org) Wed Dec  7 17:04:47 UTC 2011
Term: 80x24
4 0
SeaBIOS (version seabios-0.6.1.2-28.el6)
Machine UUID ebdb0d2c-ab22-6e06-f954-0ae6e2afd247

....

fields.summary: High instance churn causes the metadata service to fail.
fields.environment:
* non-HA, single cluster
** 1 x CLC
** 1 x Walrus, UFS
** 1 x UFS
** 1 x CC/SC (overlay)
** 2 x NCs

comments.body: Attached sosreports.  There is an issue with eucalyptus-sosreport-plugins and euca2ools configuration file.  Logs are available however.  I will put all the resource commands in a separate comment.

*Interesting Log Entry*

Looks like ELB is having a hard time getting CloudWatch data:

*cloud-output.log*
{code}

[~hspencer], the steps to reproduce this instance metadata service issue seem incomplete as they do not mention the instance metadata service.

[~sjones], the instance metadata service was queried by cloud-init.  In the description above, the output from euca-get-console-output shows the following:
{code}
